sections.title: What date did your business first commercially exploit aggregates?

fields.label: What date did your business first commercially exploit aggregates?
fields.shortName: Date busines first commercially exploited aggregates
fields.helpText: Enter the date your business first commercially exploited aggregates or formed the intention to. For example 21 4 2018

fields.label: What is commercially exploiting aggregates?
fields.infoText:
Aggregate is considered as being commercially exploited when it is exploited for the benefit of business. For example when it is:

* removed from its originating site or a connected site that is registered under the same name 


* subject to an agreement to supply (such as a contract)


* used for construction purposes 


* mixed with anything other than water, except in permitted circumstances 

You become liable to register for aggregates  levy when you first commercially exploit aggregates or form the intention to.

Full details are given in Excise Notice AGL1.

sections.title: Estimate how much aggregates levy you'll pay in the next 12 months

fields.label: Estimate how much aggregates levy you'll pay in the next 12 months
fields.shortName: Estimate of aggregates levy payment for next 12 months
fields.helpText: Multiply the number of tonnes of aggregates you think you'll commercially exploit by the rate of aggregates levy

fields.id: What is the rate of aggregates levy?
fields.label: Where can I find out the current rate of levy?
fields.infoText: The current rate for aggregates levy can be found in section 1.7 of Excise Notice AGL1.

sections.title: Do you expect any of your commercial activity to be exempt or relieved from the levy?
sections.shortName: Activities exempt or relieved from the levy

fields.label: Do you expect any of your commercial activity to be exempt or relieved from the levy?
fields.shortName: Do you expect any of your commercial activitity be exempt or relieved from the levy

fields.label: What commercial activity is exempt or relieved from the levy?
fields.infoText:
Commercial aggregates activitity involving the following substances (when they make up more than half of the total material) are exempt from the levy:

* coal, lignite, clay, slate, soil or vegetable or other organic matter

* blocks of stone (dimension stone) and limestone for the production of lime or cement

* certain industrial minerals (such as metal ores, gypsum, fluorspar)

* waste that's wholly from industrial combustion processes or the smelting or refining of metals

* drill cuttings (in permitted circumstances) and waste from certain processes such as highways or railways excavation, navigational dredging and building construction (in permitted circumstances)

Commercial activity involving the following aggregates are relieved from the levy:

* any aggregate used in certain industrial or agricultural processes (such as glass manufacture, fertiliser production)

* aggregate that has previously carried levy and to which an exempt process is applied

Relief can also be obtained on aggregates that are exported to a destination outside of the UK.

Full details of the exemptions and reliefs are given in Excise Notices AGL1 and AGL2.

declarationSection.title: Confirm details and send your registration

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm we have received your registration

fields.label: Select the status relevant to you
fields.helpText: For limited companies, a director or company secretary must complete this declaration

fields.infoText: By entering your full name above you confirm that the information you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a PDF copy of your submitted registration.

You must check the guidance for this service on GOV.UK to see whether you need to fill in and send any additional forms to complete your registration (for example if you are a partnership you must also fill in and send form AL2) if you haven't already done so.

HMRC will send you a letter to confirm your registration details and return dates so that you can prepare your first aggregates levy return. 

Returns will normally cover a 3 month period but if you would like to apply to for non-standard periods, such as monthly returns, or periods that match your VAT return periods, you can contact the (EEITS) team on enquiries.eeitts@hmrc.gsi.gov.uk

If you do not use a weighbridge you will also need to get in touch with the EEITS team to agree an alternative method for weighing your aggregates.
